main event: A bright white object, approximately 1 degree in diameter, was observed on a straight flight path at a very high speed, leaving a faint trail as it moved from horizon to horizon in approximately 3 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared bright white, approximately 1 degree in diameter, and moved on a straight flight path at a very high speed.
The object left a faint trail as it moved from horizon to horizon in approximately 3 minutes.
The report concluded that the object was likely a satellite.
The object was first observed directly overhead at an extremely high altitude and then disappeared on the horizon.
The report mentions that the track and regularity of altitude indicate a non-meteorological origin and suggest a satellite-type object in orbit.
sighted object: Bright white object, approximately 1 degree in diameter
